> Hmm.. Nothing in the source code to suggest an immunity. Are you
sure it had absolutely no effect, like the skeleton's HP didn't
decrease at all? 

Well, I didn't gain any experience points when I used my heartburst
attack agains the Giant Skeleton in question.

> Any chance that it was invulnerable?

There's a 350% chance that it was vulnverable - 1)I designed that
scenario and there are no invulnerablity potions in it and 2)my mage's
regular attack was having an effect.

I was testing my new version of Scenario 121.  I'm very happy with my
new map [solved a lot of the crowding problems walking through
diagonal tree lines :-) ] , but I feel like it needs a few more
treehouses.

* * * *

I found something really valuable: I was working on an easier way to
design scenarios by exception-handling.  The user would specify the
default map tile and then list the areas where there was an exception
and what to place in the exception.

I got it work with putting a line on a map and doing a box shape, but
I was totally confused about doing a generic polygon.

The problem was how to know for sure that I was picking changing the
tiles inside the polygon and not outside.  I got the program to do all
the lines for each side, but never did complete the part about how to
know beyond a doubt that I'm picking points on the inside of the
polygon, not the outside.

Does anybody know the solution to my dilemna?
